definition: sports such as soccer, basketball and volleyball that use large balls/see also 小球[xiao3 qiu2]
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother

sentences.english: There is no crushing monumental axis leading into the stadium as there was in Berlin.
sentences.chinese: 有没有破碎气壮山河的轴领导到大球场，因此在柏林。

sentences.english: Though she's on the rebound, and now she's ricocheting off the Big Balls.
sentences.chinese: 虽然她被弹了回来，现在她正在弹开大球。

sentences.english: The elite player's services spot are often left half table's shortness.
sentences.chinese: 改大球后左短与中短是优秀运动员常用发球落点。

sentences.english: And it looks like the top stadium that you will find in some of top leagues around Europe.
sentences.chinese: 它看起来像你在欧洲见到的顶级大球场一样。

sentences.english: The elite players' standing position when receiving the 40mm ball after service is main on the side of the left half table.
sentences.chinese: 改大球后优秀运动员接发球站位仍以左半台站位为主。

sentences.english: Thick bunches of trees indicated the woods and shrubberies.
sentences.chinese: 树丛和森林看上去象是一些大球球。

sentences.english: It is amazing to me how many multiple-course facilities are under construction and in planning there.
sentences.chinese: 有许多复合型大球场在建和计划中，这些令我震惊。

sentences.english: The sun looks like a shiny gold plate , but it is really a big ball.
sentences.chinese: 太阳看起来像一个发光的金盘，但实际上是个大球。

definition: sports such as ping-pong and badminton that use small balls/see also 大球[da4 qiu2]
to try to answer a question (in a quiz, guessing game, riddle etc)/quiz game

pinyin: Men2 xing1 ge2 la1 de2 ba1 he4
